page.title: 03GRASSMOOR TRAINING CENTRE
page.content: The{Grassmoor Training Centre,}opened} in 1952, covers an area of 6 acres. It is built on the site of the exhausted {Grassmoor Colliery.}The centre, which trains men for the North Derbyshire coalfields, is unique. On the one site are facilities for training mining, electrical and mechanical engineers for the coal industry. About fifty men spend up to eleven weeks at the centre on training or refresher courses. The site has several classrooms and workshops, offices, a cafe, a gym as well as numerous galleries. These are tunnels built on the surface to give the men realistic experiences of mining life. Before they enter the galleries the men have to go to a Contraband Zone where they are checked for dangerous items just as if they were going into a real mine. The site also has various sporting facilities.
